author: axic3354
content: The main dispute was that people like the proposal, and would like it to be adopted, but the specification makes that not possible, because it stipulates which chain id has it turned on. Once it turns final, the EIP can't be changed to have it adopted by other chains -- at least that is the debate.

author: axic3354
content:
I think this is a subjective decision about usefulness.

If we care about usefulness of final EIPs, then it would be important to guide authors to make sure their EIP is as useful as possible, in this case that means it is easily adoptable without the need to change the EIP text at every single occasion.

If we want to avoid this hurdle of subjective judging, then once an EIP fulfils the technical requirements, it should be allowed to progress to final, despite to various concerns/disagreements. It just means people can fork the EIP and create a new one which they deem is better.
